event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected on a PCI-Express card in a PCI slot.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates a diagnosis of a fatal error detected on a PCI-Express card in a PCI slot.

The domain using the PCI slot is reset and the PCI-Express card is deconfigured.

The deconfiguration is not persistent across platform power cycles
or across Dynamic Reconfiguration operations.


The recommended service action for this event is to replace the PCI-Express card.

   If the problem persists, proceed with the steps outlined below.


   LEGEND

    RED      = SUNW-MSG-ID
    BLUE    = EVENT_ID
    GREEN = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Apr 12 16:42:36 san-dc3-1-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: BE80601000  
   EVENT-ID: 5195e088-6f68-48fe-b97b-6e818a337a07
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8001-RP for detailed information.

   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8001-RP, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical    
   EVENT-TIME: Thu Apr 12 16:42:36 PDT 2007    
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: san-dc3-1-0    
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12    
   EVENT-ID:5195e088-6f68-48fe-b97b-6e818a337a07   
   DESC: A fatal error was detected on a PCI-Express card in a PCI slot.    
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8001-RP for more information.    
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The PCI-Express card is deconfigured.    
   IMPACT: The domain using the PCI slot is reset.    
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.    
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
   

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 5195e088-6f68-48fe-b97b-6e818a337a07

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Apr 12 16:42:36.7013 5195e088-6f68-48fe-b97b-6e818a337a07 SCF-8001-RP            
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.io.pciex.card.fe                   
                 
                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/pcislot=0                     
                    Affects: -                         
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=BE80601000:
                                   server-id=san-dc3-1-0/component=/IOU#0/PCI#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain using the PCI slot is reset.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error detected on a PCI-Express card in a PCI slot.
